p:
Respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) infection contributes to significant morbidity and mortality associated with lower respiratory tract infection . Illness associated with RSV infection is estimated to cause approximately 24.8 million episodes and 76,600 deaths annually
1 . Epidemiological studies have shown that infants, young children, and the elderly are especially at risk of RSV infection
2, 3, 4 . In regions with temperate climate, incidence of RSV infection concentrates during the winter months and may sometimes be absent in summertime
5 . In sub-tropical and tropical regions, RSV infection may be sporadic throughout the year or showed increased activity during the rainy or cooler months
6 .
